meanings.definition: Twist or bend out of the normal shape
meanings.sent1: She was contorting her body to fit into the small box.
meanings.sent2: The acrobat was contorting her body into various shapes during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The contorting balloon animal made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: His contorting dance moves on stage amazed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The contorting tree branches looked like they were dancing in the wind.

meanings.definition: Distort or twist out of shape
meanings.sent1: The artist was contorting the clay into a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The magician was contorting reality with his mind-bending tricks.
meanings.sent3: The contorting mirror at the carnival made everyone look funny.
meanings.sent4: Her contorting story about aliens visiting Earth was captivating.
meanings.sent5: The contorting shadows on the wall looked like mysterious creatures.

meanings.definition: To twist or bend something out of its normal shape or position
meanings.sent1: He was contorting the wire to create a new sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The contorting branches of the tree reached out in all directions.
meanings.sent3: The contorting straw in his drink made it hard to sip.
meanings.sent4: The contorting road ahead seemed like a rollercoaster.
meanings.sent5: The contorting metal gate creaked as it opened slowly.
